106 Poromac RIVER BRIDGE

(below water)

10 X 3.142 X 17.5 X 2 = 1100 8. f.
(strut) (2 X 36 X 2) + (5 X 36) = 324 s. f.
(bell) 19 X 15.3 X 2 X 3.142 = 1825 s. f.
(ring) 3.142 X 28 X 4 X 2 = 704 s. f.
3953 s. 1.
add 259, for details 988 s. 1.

4941 s. 1. X 15.3%s1. X 490 66

Ea
Total Dead Load
Pier including piles 3867"
Superstructure 2636"
Tower = 41 X .75° 31*
6534"
Total Live Load 735"

Moment of Overturning Forces on Pier

Forces acting on substructure and superstructure are shown on Figure 11.

Lever arm of each force equals the algebraic difference between the elevation at which
force is acting and the elevation of center of moments.

Center of moments shown at elevation —59.4.
Arrangement of the piles and the moment of inertia of the group is shown on Figure 12.

Transverse Forces
Refer to Figure 11.

(B) Wind 30*/sq. ft. on Truss, Floor & Rail 435 X 151.0 = 65,685
(©) 30*/sq. ft. on Tower 3 X 88.7 = 266
(D) 30*/sq. ft. on Pier X 2 1.7 X 65.2 = 111
Total force 439.7° Total Mom. = 66,062
(A) Wind 100*/lin. ft. on Live Load 52.5° X 180.0’ = 9,450
(E) Ice 25% per ft. width of Pier 250 X 60.9’ = 15,225*
(F) Current 25*/sq. ft. of Area in Elev. 11.7% X 48.7 = 570"

Longitudinal Forces

The superstructure is supported on a rocker or roller nest at Pier Number 9, therefore
no longitudinal force can be transmitted to the pier. Consequently longitudinal wind
and the force due to traction do not enter these computations.

Typical computations for Pile “A” under all cases are included in these calculations.
